abstract: The channel would combine resources from ABC News and Univision’s news division to take on established players like CNN, MSNBC and Fox News.
snippet: The channel would combine resources from ABC News and Univision’s news division to take on established players like CNN, MSNBC and Fox News.
lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company may join Univision, the dominant Spanish-language broadcaster in the United States, in starting an English-language cable news channel this year, people with knowledge of the talks between the companies said on Monday.

headline.main: Univision and Disney in Talks for an English-Language News Channel

byline.original: By Brian Stelter and Amy Chozick

abstract: The long-brewing business plan that became public on Monday would offer both networks access to the growing audience of English-speaking Hispanics in the United States. It would also give ABC News a prominent cable outlet.
snippet: The long-brewing business plan that became public on Monday would offer both networks access to the growing audience of English-speaking Hispanics in the United States. It would also give ABC News a prominent cable outlet.
lead_paragraph: A long-brewing business plan between Univision and the Walt Disney Company’s ABC News division to start an English-language cable news channel has been made public. Though no announcement appears to be imminent, the television-news industry is now abuzz over the possibilities.

headline.main: Why a Univision-ABC Partnership Might Make Sense

abstract: Operating income at Disney’s parks division was up 18 percent over the same quarter a year ago, a positive sign for the broader economy and an indication of that sector’s overall strength. The company’s cable division also did well, but the film unit’s performance was more mixed.
snippet: Operating income at Disney’s parks division was up 18 percent over the same quarter a year ago, a positive sign for the broader economy and an indication of that sector’s overall strength. The company’s cable division also did well, but the film u...
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Vacationers are opening their wallets more freely than they have in years at Disney’s theme parks, adding to signs of growing consumer confidence and contributing to a climbing quarterly profit at the entertainment conglomerate.

headline.main: Theme Park Income Spurs Profits at Disney
